meanings.definition: The act or process of dividing something into periods.
meanings.sent1: In school, we learned about periodization when studying the Stone Age and the Bronze Age.
meanings.sent2: Historians use periodization to understand different eras in human history.
meanings.sent3: The periodization of my day into study time and playtime helps me stay organized.
meanings.sent4: Just like chapters in a book, periodization helps us make sense of the past.
meanings.sent5: The periodization of the museum exhibit made it easy to follow the timeline of art history.

meanings.definition: The organization of history into distinct periods for analysis.
meanings.sent1: Teachers use periodization to explain how events in history are connected.
meanings.sent2: The periodization of ancient civilizations helps us understand their development.
meanings.sent3: The periodization of history can sometimes make it feel like time travel!
meanings.sent4: In the story of human civilization, periodization acts as signposts along the way.
meanings.sent5: The vivid periodization of the museum exhibit brought the past to life before my eyes.

meanings.definition: The planning and scheduling of training in sports.
meanings.sent1: Athletes rely on periodization to optimize their performance during competitions.
meanings.sent2: Coaches use periodization to structure training sessions throughout the season.
meanings.sent3: The periodization of my workout routine keeps me on track to reach my fitness goals.
meanings.sent4: Like a roadmap, periodization guides athletes towards peak performance.
meanings.sent5: The periodization of training sessions made each step towards the championship more deliberate.
